home.name: Jun Kai
home.aboutMe:
Software developer with a passion for frontend technologies.

Extensive experience in Web, Mobile application and Desktop application development; in both frontend and backend, both at startup and large company. Adept understanding of AI/ML gained through research project.

emailDialog.title: Get in touch with me
emailDialog.description: Hey! One more step to get in touch with me. I will try my best to reply ASAP!

kipo.description: Joined Kipo on NTU OEP programme to build systems to make millions of parts searchable

dsbj.bullet1: Implemented a model visualization and analysis platform with Al-driven insights in Python and Nextjs, enabling business units and data scientists to interact with and evaluate mathematical optimization and Al models.
dsbj.bullet2: Established a robust Single Sign On (SSO) backend framework, and unified authentication for two existing projects.
dsbj.bullet3: Designed an LLM-powered system using LangChain to extract insights from unstructured data.

works.position: Mobile Application & Web Application Developer, Intern
works.bullet1: Began as a Flutter mobile developer, brought onto Angular web team, and contributed 80% of the total codebase.
works.bullet2: Collaborated to create features for both platforms, such as a chat interface, payment processing pages, mobile responsive Ul and other frontend Ul updates, ensuring cross platform feature parity.
works.bullet3: Diagnosed and resolved user-reported bugs, eliminating 90% of non-fatal frontend errors in two weeks.

ai4x.title: Quantifying Uncertainty in Physics-Informed Neural Networks
ai4x.description: We used deep evidential regression to quantify uncertainties in physics-informed neural networks, demonstrating it on the Burgers and Laplace experiments.
ai4x.abstract: We integrate a state-of-the-art method to quantify aleatoric and epistemic uncertainties in physics-informed neural networks and observe that they can be captured effectively while maintaining predictive accuracy.

ntu.bullet1: Elective Focus in Security & Artificial Intelligence

oceanfrontHardware.name: Oceanfront Hardware
oceanfrontHardware.description: Freelanced as a full-stack web developer for this hardware company. Focused on SEO performance and CMS integration.
oceanfrontHardware.bullet1: Developed a company website with e-commerce functionality in two months using Vue.js (Vite), and Strapi CMS, with Stripe for payment processing
oceanfrontHardware.bullet2: Adopted Meilisearch to upgrade search functionality, reducing query response time from 700ms to 20ms
oceanfrontHardware.bullet3: Migrated frontend to Nuxtjs, leveraged server-side rendering (SSR) enhancing SEO and page load speed to 800ms
